text: Deletion reporter gene analysis of LPS and PMA - responsive regions in the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
( A ) Schematic representation of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 promoter and 5' deletion luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constructs .

The murine 5 ' flanking region from -4480 to +92 was inserted upstream of the <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene and 5 ' deletions were generated using restriction enzyme sites or with specific oligonucleotide PCR primers .
Construct names indicate the most 5 ' nucleotide of murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking sequence .

( B ) RAW 264.7 macrophages were transiently transfected with the indicated murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 promoter-luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constructs and control plasmids .
Cells were either left untreated or treated with 100 ng / ml LPS or 40 ng / ml PMA for 16 hrs .
Shown is the relative <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene activity following treatment .
The results represent the mean and SEM of four independent experiments .
( C ) DNA sequence conservation between the human and murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking regions .

Schematic representation of the human and murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking regions with regions of nucleotide sequence identity indicated by the same colored boxes .
Homologous regions are interrupted by repetitive sequence elements in both 5 ' flanking regions .

Alu = Alu repeat , ID4 = ID4 short interspersed nuclear repeat ( SINE ) , L1 = L1 long interspersed nuclear element ( LINE ) , L2 = L2 LINE , MIR = MIR SINE , MLT1L = MLT1L long terminal repeat ( LTR ) , ( TATG ) n = TATG tetranucleotide repeat , tis = transcription initiation site .
